'''''ungwë''''' is a noun meaning "spider's web" in [[Quenya]].<ref name="Names">{{App|Letters}}, Note, ''The names of the letters''</ref>

[[Image:Ungwe.gif|left]]''Ungwë'' is also the name in Quenya of the eighth letter of the [[Tengwar]] alphabet.<ref name="Names"/>  It is the fourth letter of the second grade or [[Tyellë]], which contains "voiced stops" and it is the first letter in the fourth series of consonants.  For written Quenya or [[Sindarin]], the fourth series is used for the labialized or ''kw''-series, the ''[[Quessetéma]]''.<ref name="Letters">{{App|Letters}}</ref>  In the standard spelling of Quenya, ''Ungwë''represents '''NGW'''<ref>{{App|Letters}}, Note</ref> while in [[Sindarin]] this letter represents '''GW'''.  In [[Westron]] the fourth series is used for the ''k''-series, the ''[[Calmatéma]]'', and this letter represents '''G'''.<ref name="Letters"/> The Westron name for this letter is '''''Gá'''''.<ref>See ''[[Alphabet of Fëanor: Numenian, or Westron, Mode]]''</ref>

==Etymology==
The word derives from the [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] [[UÑG]].<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, UÑG-</ref>

==Example==
* [[Ungoliant]] = "Gloomy Spider" or "Gloomweaver"
